DataElement.preferredName: Protocol Deviation Performed Observation Outcome Identifier ISO21090.II.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A variation from process or procedures defined in a study protocol. EXAMPLE(S): Study subject not withdrawn as per protocol, excluded concomitant medication, treatment deviation. NOTE(S): Deviations usually do not preclude the overall evaluability of subject data for either efficacy or safety. The unique symbol that establishes identity of the observation result.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Protocol Deviation Performed Observation Outcome Identifier
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An unintended departure from the study plan which has not been prospectively reviewed and approved by the IRB and FDA.:Executed and carried through to completion.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An unintended departure from the study plan which has not been prospectively reviewed and approved by the IRB and FDA.:Executed and carried through to completion.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: A variation from processes or procedures defined in a protocol. Deviations usually do not preclude the overall evaluability of subject data for either efficacy or safety, and are often acknowledged and accepted in advance by the sponsor. (CDISC Glossary)
Executed and carried through to completion.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.
